job.name: SetJobResourceJob
job.title: Can be used to populate the JS7 inventory from Job Resources

note.title: The path to the Job Resource that should be created or updated. Both specification of a path and specification of the name can be used.
The name of the variable in the Job Resource (case-sensitive).
The value of the variable
note.p:
The value allows any strings, numbers etc.
A special syntax is supported for date values: [<java-date-pattern>]:
for example [dd/MM/yyyy], [yyyy-MM-dd], [yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss], [yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ssZ]
The Java date pattern will by replaced by the job for the current date and time value. > >

note.title: The name of a file
note.p: The content of the file will be used as value in the job resource. The content is stored with to_file().

note.title: The certificate
note.p: The CA signed or self-signed X.509 certificate. Alternatively the public key can be specified. This variable is normally provided via a job resource that is managed with the certificate management.

note.title: If a Java date pattern is specified then the date is calculated for the given time zone.
note.p: The time zone is specified from a string, for example "GMT", "Europe/London". Valid time zone strings as explained with https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones can be specified. If this argument is omitted then the time zone that the Agent is operated for will be used.

note.title: The name of an environment variable in the Job Resource that should automatically be populated with the value specified for the key
note.p: Technically the environment variable will hold a reference to the key.

note.title: The Controller ID identifies the Controller to which the updated Job Resource will be deployed.
note.p: If this argument is omitted then the default Controller will be used that is available from the JOC Cockpit user profile that is in place for the account that connects to JOC Cockpit.

documentation.note:
What is the purpose of this job?
The JITL SetJobResourceJob template can be used to populate the JS7 inventory from Job Resources
to add or update a variable in a Job Resource,
to deploy a Job Resource.
The JITL SetJobResourceJob template can be used for example to set a variable holding a business date:
the variable in the Job Resource can be updated with the current date and time.
the updated Job Resource is automatically deployed and becomes available to related Agents.
any workflow that is assigned the Job Resource has access to the updated variable.
The JITL job connects to JOC Cockpit using user/password authentication and/or certificate based authentication. The job makes use of authentication settings as explained with https://kb.sos-berlin.com/display/JS7/JS7+-+JITL+Common+Authentication >
